text:
West Kilbride
West Kilbride is a historic small town in North Ayrshire, Scotland.
In September 2006, West Kilbride won First Prize in the "Enterprising Britain 2006" award, for its "Craft Town Scotland" initiative.
By car
The A78 - picturesque coastal route, wending through North Ayrshire.
By bus
Stagecoach and Shuttle Buses both provide a regular service;
By train
Regular passenger trains from Largs to Glasgow Central Station;
By plane Prestwick Airport and Glasgow Airport are convenient.
Get around
Eddie's Taxis, ☏ +44 1294 822812 .
See
West Kilbride Museum, West Kilbride Village Hall, 1 Arthur Street. Tue, Thu, Sat:10:30am – 12:30pm, 2:00pm – 4:00pm. free.
Portencross Castle.
Law Castle.
Seamill Beach.
Ardneil Bay.
Hunterston B nuclear power station. Visitor centre, and tours of the power station are available if UK citizens book 3 weeks in advance, (4+ weeks for foreigners). The AGR (Advanced Gas cooled Reactor) power station has been generating since 1976, and is scheduled to operate until 2023. The older Magnox Hunterston A next door operated from 1957 to 1990.
Do
West Kilbride Golf Club, Fullarton Drive, Seamill. This well-respected 18-hole links course offers many challenges to test even the seasoned golfer. The fabulous view of Arran makes a wonderful backdrop to your game - and you may find it hard not to take your eye off the ball! Relax in the clubhouse afterwards. from £30 (winter round).
Kirktonhall Glen. is a woodland walkway leading from West Kilbride to Seamill, gifted to West Kilbride in 1924 by Robert Barr. Through it flows the Kilbride Burn which enters the Firth of Clyde at Seamill.
Craft Town Scotland art gallery and museum, The Barony Centre, 50 Main Street, ☏ +44 1294 829179 .
Buy
West Kibride has recently been dubbed "The UK's Capital of Enterprise" because of its pioneering Craft Town Scotland initiative. Its growing colony of top-class craftspeople and retail shops deserves your support. Now is the time to invest in original and stylish works of art - for example, from Silversmith Marion Kane; Nicola Beattie, candle-maker; and many others.
A Gift Tae Gie, 45 Main Street, ☏ +44 1294 829509 . offers a fantastic array of gifts, toys, cards and interior accessories for all ages.
Glenbryde, 31 Ritchie Street, ☏ +44 1294 829839 . specialises in the sale of quality clocks and barometers.
Eat
Various Indian and Chinese take-aways in the centre of town
The Cherry Orchard, 2C Orchard St, ☏ +44 1294 824880 . delightful coffee-shop in the heart of West Kilbride
Seamill Hydro Hotel and Resort, 39 Ardrossan Rd, Seamill, ☏ +44 1294 822217 . beautiful restaurant with a la carte and table d'hote menus.
Further afield
The Catch At Fins Restaurant, Fencefoot Farm, Fairlie, KA29 0EG. Thu - Sat: noon - 3PM, 6PM - 9PM; Sun: 12PM - 3PM. award-winning seafood restaurant mains from £12.
Braidwoods, Dalry. Michelin star restaurant dinner from £50.
Drink
The Kilbride Tavern and the King's Arms are typical Scottish pubs, located in the heart of West Kilbride.
The Wee Deli, 2 Ritchie Street, ☏ +44 1294 822015 . A tardis of food delights. Best known for the wee deli pate & soups.
Sleep
Carlton Seamill Bed & Breakfast, 53 Ardrossan Road, Seamill, ☏ +44 1294 822075 , ✉ carlton@westkilbride.net . Impressive Scottish Victorian house and garden. Generous Traditional Scottish Breakfast. Rooms from £65 per couple per night..
The Waterside, Ardrossan Rd., ☏ +44 1294 824414 .
Go next
Major tourist attractions near here are:
Isle of Arran (Brodick);
Isle of Great Cumbrae (Millport)
Isle of Bute (Rothesay and Mount Stuart)
Loch Lomond and The Trossachs National Park
Clyde Muirshiel Regional Park; City of Glasgow
Robert Burns Heritage Trail; Kelburn Castle and Country Estate
Important golf courses within easy reach - for example, Royal Troon and Prestwick
